The Narzissenkreuz Ordo

The Narzissenkreuz Ordo was a secret esoteric organization founded by Rene de Petrichor and Jakob Ingold about 450 years ago. The organization's main goal was to prevent the consequences of the Apocalypse by shedding the limitations of physical form and separation. To achieve this goal, they conducted experiments to create Neohumans. The Ordo’s philosophy is based on the records of ancient Remuria, a golden empire that fell thousands of years ago. The Narzissenkreuz Ordo used the "Seal of Chymical Marriage," a magical technique left behind by the Golden Troupe, to identify four essential points in Fontaine. They built the Tower of
at the intersection of these points to perform a ritual of liberation.
Because of their experiments, the organization was declared illegal by the decree of Iudex of Fontaine, Neuvillette, and Alain Guillotin, a former friend of Rene and Jakob. The Marechaussee Phantom was ordered to arrest all members of the Narzissenkreuz Ordo and seal the Tower of Gestalt.

customize.text: Sumeru Expedition

Rene de Petrichor and Jakob Baker grew up together in the Narzissenkreuz Institute, an orphanage in Fontaine. Rene's parents and Jakob's father were killed in the siege of Poisson. During their time at the Institute, they formed a close bond with Oceanid Lyris, the orphanage's Director, and Mary-Ann and Alain, their childhood friends.

500 years ago, the Cataclysm occurred, causing the Narzissenkreuz Institute to disband. A journalist Karl Ingold, who was present during the siege of Poisson, took Rene and Jakob in the family, and, eventually, Jakob took his last name, becoming Jakob Ingold. After the Cataclysm, Rene, Jakob, and Karl left for an expedition to Vourukasha Oasis in Sumeru. Rene became fascinated by Khvarena and the Sacred Lotus, Gaokerena, created by The Greater Lord Rukkhadevata from the consciousness of the former Hydro Archon Egeria. He observed that it shared a similar composition to the tissues in the organisms of Jakob and Rene himself but different from the tissues of Karl. Despite Rene's attempts to obtain more data samples to verify this finding, Shamaniyya refused his requests. In addition, he discovered some Khaenri'ahn records, with the help of which he later created the world-formula.
During the expedition, Jakob, a child at the time, fell seriously ill and lapsed into a coma. Desperate to save him, Rene resorted to using powers akin to those of the Abyss. Jakob's body responded favorably to these powers, facilitating his recovery. Emboldened by this success, Rene incorporated the results into his ongoing research. Karl Ingold, however, harbored suspicions regarding Jakob's sudden recovery. To dispel these suspicions, Rene fabricated and altered diaries.

customize.text: Creation of the Narzissenkreuz Ordo

After the desert expedition, Rene was assigned to his friend Alain's laboratory at the Institute of Natural Philosophy. During Rene's work there, he used the influence and connections of some scientists outside the Institute to obtain the necessary resources and funding for his research. Some scientists from the Institute of Natural Philosophy became the organization's first members after the Institute was disbanded.
Thanks to Rene's charisma and Jakob's "tricks," organization members began to follow their leader loyally. Rene decided to form a "society" and call it the Narzissenkreuz Ordo to give them organization and a sense of belonging. Gradually, the influence and popularity of the organization grew, and some famous researchers, historians, and people from high society joined it.
Years later, Oceanid Lyris, the former Director of the Narzissenkreuz Institute, the orphanage where Rene and Jakob grew up, joined the organization. She had the ability to unite and divide "will," which made her a valuable member of the Ordo.

customize.text: Philosophy

On one of Rene's trips to Petrichor, he uncovered the records of the Golden Troupe, established by the surviving Remurians that gathered here many years ago. Among them, he found the term "Fortuna" which said that kingdoms rise and fall, and when a civilization is annihilated, a new one will be born from the ashes. This phenomenon turned out to be similar to Rene's computational scheme, called the "world-formula." After countless calculations, he found a discrepancy with Fortuna: unlike the world depicted in these ancient texts, there will be no more new civilizations born. This apocalypse was associated with the ancient prophecy of Fontaine: <color=#ffffffd9>"In the end, the people will all be dissolved into the waters, and only the Hydro Archon will remain, weeping on her throne..."</color> Like the ancient Remurians, Rene wanted to escape fate and avoid the promised Apocalypse, so he founded the Narzissenkreuz Ordo.

Ancient Remurians believed that complete mastery over the body by one's will was the consummation of human virtue, a pinnacle that only gods and the rarest of mortals could come close to attaining. Following moral decay, the will became shackled to bodily form, willpower withered, and humanity became entirely enslaved to their flesh. The Remurians reached heights that were challenging to attain in study and differentiation of the spirit. According to the Harmost Aurelius, all phenomena were divided into four categories: Substance, Property, Quality, and Relation. Quality was the keystone, which is what is often called the "Quadrant of Qualities": memories, wishes, soul, and persona. Spirit was also divided into these four components. Among these, the state that came closest to the perfect freedom that divinities possessed was named "True Will." Ancient Remurians saw it as the detachment of human will with such meticulous research. Upon learning of this, Rene decided that separating a person's will could be the key to salvation from the prophecy. The God King Remus created imperishable bodies of stone and bronze for the Remurians. The Remurians wanted to create an object endowed with meaning, the essence of which would be determined only by Quality. One of these items was a sword forged in memory of the Harmost Euergetia. Rene wanted to create Neohumans and separate the will of the Fontainians to wait out the apocalypse and escape fate. At the Narzissenkreuz Institute, Rene discovered the Holy Blade of Narzissenkreuz, capable of uniting and concentrating the will of many people. In the Narzissenkreuz Ordo's brand of mystical philosophy, the Holy Blade was "reason," that which cuts everything open. It could only be born out of consummate human will. The Ordo used this sword to sever the people's will. Just like the Remurians separated their melody in order to escape the prisons of rotting flesh and gain eternal and independent life, the Narzissenkreuz Ordo wanted to get rid of the shackles of the physical body through the separation of the will.

<color=#ffffffd9>"...To excise the self is not to die, but rather to die before death. That way, there is no life to be ended. Thus may one achieve eternity. This step is vital, for by this, may one avoid receiving a Vision by some error. To receive a Vision to sell oneself to the "fate" of this world — to Heimarmene, and to evermore lose the chance to walk the correct path."</color>

In the records, Rene discovered the "Seal of Chymical Marriage" — a special magical technique left by the Golden Troupe. The technique consisted of two parts: "Circle of Four Orthants" and "Tree of Emanation." According to the Golden Troupe's records, there were several important places in Fontaine needed to seal the
Rene set the organization's goal to search for the Orthants and build the Tower of Ipsissimus in the center of the Circle of Four Orthants. The necessary points were found by changes in the composition of the water — in the right places it contained water from the Primordial Sea. All Orthants were named after the "Quadrant of Qualities": Orthant of memories, wishes, soul, and persona. The Tower of Ipsissimus originated from an old concept from the ancient Fontainian kingdom of Remuria and was used to describe a powerful will that could rule, sustain, and destroy the world. The tower represented the evolution of the human soul and the infinite mysteries of the world. The Narzissenkreuz Ordo believed that people continuously refine themselves through samsara cycles. These included Hyperborea, Natlantean, Remuria, and the first half of the
which humanity was presently experiencing. On one of the upper levels of the tower, the headquarters of the Ordo was situated.

On the ceiling of the room, a huge Doomsday clock was set, which counted down the time until the apocalypse predicted by the "world formula." The Tower of Gestalt was supposed to be a key element for controlling the will of people with the help of the Holy Blade of Narzissenkreuz and the abilities of Lyris. Three special keys were designed for the tower, capable of lowering it underwater and opening a passage to the Primordial Sea. When combined, the keys form a peculiar shape of three and a half circles. The innermost circle is the Cycle of Hyperborea, symbolizing the age when the world was frozen and the lost paradise. The middle circle is the Cycle of Natlantean, symbolizing the triumph over the evil dragon, a metaphor for humanity's victory over nature as well as the beasts within themselves. The third circle and outermost half circle are the Cycles of Remuria and Khraun-Arya, symbolizing the relationship between humans and gods.

customize.text: Experiments and Ban of the Ordo

When the beast from the Abyss, Elynas, was defeated during the Cataclysm, Rene, and Jakob became interested in his body as they felt glimpses of "will." Assuming that the monster had a wellspring of vitality, Rene wanted to use this principle to enhance Jakob's strength gained during the Sumeru expedition. Jakob, despite Rene's fears and warnings, secretly entered Elynas's body, obtaining samples of his flesh and blood. His body again accepted the flesh favorably enough only with minor adverse reactions, which prompted them to continue experiments to improve Jakob.

Rene recorded all his research in a book called The Book of Revealing. There he described his work at the Institute of Natural Philosophy and experiments on assistant Carter Scherbius, who was suffering from an incurable disease; experiments on Jakob to create the first Neohuman; the special Remurian technique "Seal of Chymical Marriage;" extracting the will of people to obtain their knowledge and skills; the construction of the Tower of Ipsissimus, with the help of which the Narzissenkreuz Ordo were going to extract the will of all the people in Fontaine; as well as his becoming Narzissenkreuz. The book led to a mysterious subspace that reflected a possible future after the Apocalypse. In this world, even mint and sweet flowers don't grow.

Through experimentation, Jakob managed to open a "passage," which they learned about from the Khaenri'ahn records, surrounding themselves with many creatures, which Rene later called "Rifthounds." In addition, the subject of their research was the Scarlet Quartz, the crystallized blood of the shadow dragon Durin, and the Dark Mud found in the mines of the Chasm. It turned out that the composition of all of them was similar to the flesh of Elynas, and they had a negative effect on ordinary people. Only Jakob, who was called a "Neohuman" by Rene, was able to resist this destructive influence.
To counter the prophecy,
used Lyris's power to absorb people's wills and create a Hydrotulpa. So, he dissolved several agents of the Marechaussee Phantom, probably including Emanuel Guillotin, finding out from his memories that the officials of the Court of Fontaine knew about the existence of the Ordo. He also dissolved the Duelist Champion, Marfisa, to acquire her spear mastery. In addition, some members of the Narzissenkreuz Ordo who lost their loyalty disappeared without a trace, without leaving the Tower of Ipsissimus, the Ordo's headquarters.
In addition to experiments on Jakob and other people, Rene conducted experiments on Alain Guillotin's assistant, Carter Scherbius, from the Institute of Natural Philosophy, who suffered from an incurable disease. Rene sent his tissue samples to Sumeru, where medicine was advanced, in hopes of getting answers, but no one could offer a solution. Then Jakob put forward the idea of treating Carter with the help of the Abyssal powers, which was used to save Jakob during the desert expedition. After considering Jakob's proposal and discussing all possible risks with Carter, Rene began treatment. Due to experiments on Carter using Abyssal powers, Guillotin broke off all relations with Rene and later, together with Fontaine's Iudex, Neuvillette, signed a decree on the illegality of the Narzissenkreuz Ordo and an order for their destruction. An attempt to cure Carter Scherbius led to the destruction of the tissues and death of his body, but the order later managed to transfer part of his memories into the body of a Hilichurl, and thus, Caterpillar was born. He remembered nothing about his previous life but was devoted and grateful to his Master.

customize.text: Death of Rene de Petrichor

When the construction of the four Orthants and the Tower of Ipsissimus was almost completed, Rene decided to take risks for the common goal and get rid of the useless human personality by "rediscovering himself" through the water of the Primordial Sea. The rebirth of
did not happen, and only through Jakob's efforts, the part of his personality was managed to be preserved in the Orthant. Jakob had to not only revive his friend but also hide Rene's condition and prevent the collapse of the Ordo. During numerous experiments, he managed to create an intelligent creature that even grew pseudopods, but the creature lasted only 32 days. In the end, he still managed to create a new body for Rene and implant his consciousness there. The cornerstone was a pocket watch that Alain Guillotin gave to Jakob and Rene, as it represented the time when Rene was around. After the revival, Narzissenkreuz did not remember the failure. Jakob believed that Narzissenkreuz would take long strides and walk far ahead of him once more, casting his slender shadow in the sun. He would guide all of them in shaping a new future, one in which there will be a place for everyone.

customize.text: The Destruction of the Narzissenkreuz Ordo

Around 450 to 500 years ago, Marechaussee Hunters tracked down the Narzissenkreuz Ordo members, who were about to revive the Abyssal beast Elynas through the ritual. The Marechaussee Phantom knew that Elynas could have destroyed the whole region, so they couldn't allow his revival. When Alain Guillotin found out about the upcoming ritual, he sent the thinking Mek, Seymour, to inform the Iudex of Fontaine about it.

A battle between the Marechaussee Hunters, including Mary-Ann Guillotin and Seymour, and the Narzissenkreuz Ordo members, including Jakob, Lyris, and the Ordo's assistant, Caterpillar, occurred inside Elynas's body. During the battle, an explosion killed many agents of the Marechaussee Phantom and their Meks. Mary-Ann Guillotin was on the verge of death, but she was saved by Lyris, who united their bodies and minds by hugging her, creating a new Oceanid, Mary-Ann.
After the battle between the Narzissenkreuz Ordo and the Marechaussee Phantom, Jakob fled, Caterpillar was arrested and imprisoned in the Fortress of Meropide, and the Narzissenkreuz Ordo building was sealed. This event can be considered the end of the Ordo.
Many years later, Caterpillar realized that Narzissenkreuz used Jakob, Lyris, and him as a distraction:

<color=#ffffffd9>"Looking back at it now, he was merely using us as bait. And I wasn't the only one... It was the same for Jakob, Lyris, and many others in the Ordo.</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>I'm afraid the Elynas operation was probably never more than a red herring with the goal of leading you and Guillotin away to buy him more time to execute his true plans."</color>

customize.text: Rene de Petrichor and Jakob Ingold
Childhood

Jakob was the son of Eduardo Baker, a criminal from Fleuve Cendre. The authorities of Fontaine wanted to create an undercity beneath the city, Fleuve Cendre, from the sewers under the Court of Fontaine. Since it was difficult to maintain order, Eduardo Baker and his friends seized power in Fleuve Cendre. They began to resolve disputes between Fleuve Cendre's "compatriots," bless the newly wedded, and protect the merchants from being extorted, harassed, and blackmailed by the gangs. When the authorities of the Court of Fontaine decided to purge Fleuve Cendre, Baker was arrested and exiled to the Sumeru desert. On the way to exile, he, with the help of his henchmen, fled to Poisson, taking hostage both the city itself and the members of the Maison Gardiennage who were transporting Baker. He made a number of unreasonable demands, so the Marechaussee Hunters intervened. Journalist Karl Ingold arrived in Poisson as a negotiator along with Eduardo's son, Jakob. Back then, the mayor of Poisson was Renaud de Petrichor, whose son was Rene.

Following an unsuccessful attempt to resolve the issue, the disagreement between Baker's group and the Marechaussee Hunters turned into a violent fight. As a result, Jakob, and Rene, the Poisson Mayor's son, were left orphans. They were both sent to the Narzissenkreuz Institute, an orphanage that often housed the children of criminals. The Director of the Institute was the gentle Oceanid Lyris, who was placed in charge of the Institute as a sign of gratitude to the Hydro Archon Egeria. The Institute's Vice Director was Basil Elton, formerly the head of Fontaine's fleet. At the Institute, Basil Elton told the children a fairytale about the evil dragon Narcissus, and they played Narzissen champions, mages, and princesses. At the orphanage, Jakob met Mary-Ann and Alain, with whom he and Rene became friends. Alain gave Rene and Jakob a pocket watch, and later this pocket watch was instrumental in the resurrection of Narzissenkreuz.
During the Cataclysm 500 years ago, the Institute was disbanded. Basil Elton again led the White Armada and, together with some of the Institute's students, entered into battle with the Abyss creature that appeared in Fontaine. As a farewell, she left Jakob a feather from an unknown bird, which she wore on her hat. She told him to take care of it so that she could take it back when she returned, but she never did. Director Lyris disappeared and was later seen by the Marechaussee Phantom agents wandering around the Institute. She joined the Narzissenkreuz Ordo, a secret society founded by Rene and Jakob, a few years later. Jakob was adopted by Karl Ingold, who was present at the siege of Poisson, and Rene also became part of their family.

customize.text: The Institute of Natural Philosophy

After the desert expedition, Rene was assigned to the laboratory of the Institute of Natural Philosophy with his friend Alain Guillotin and his assistant Carter Scherbius, whom Rene considered a little stupid. Although Rene and Alain had quite different interests and approaches to research, together they studied the powers of controlled annihilation of the Pneuma and Ousia that were contained in the body of every organism in Fontaine. Subsequently, Alain's studies led to Fontaine's energy revolution, making him one of the greatest scientists.
While working at the Institute of Natural Philosophy, Rene was struck by the conservatism of scientists towards new ideas, expecting an open mind from them. Despite his attitude, he tried to gain the favor of scientists for the sake of their opportunities and influence. Some of these scholars later became members of the Narzissenkreuz Ordo, almost worshiping Rene and Jakob. Rene was disappointed that the representatives of the Institute of Natural Philosophy could turn into believers, but he used their resources for his own purposes, which included the construction of the Tower of

After using powers akin to Abyssal during a desert expedition, Jakob and Rene became interested in enhancing Jakob's strength. One day, Jakob entered the body of the petrified monster of the Abyss, Elynas, who appeared in Fontaine during the Cataclysm. They felt glimpses of "will" and a wellspring of vitality, which could help Jakob. He was able to obtain samples of Elynas's flesh and blood, which his body accepted with minor adverse reactions. Subsequently, Jakob continued to constantly enhance his powers, and because of this transformation, he was able to take the form of the Iniquitous Baptist. These changes gave Rene hope that they could survive the apocalypse.

customize.text: Rene's Death

Rene believed that in order to prevent the apocalypse calculated according to the world-formula, it is necessary to free all Fontainians from their physical body, dissolving them in the water of the Primordial Sea and returning to their origins (since all Fontainians were originally Oceanids, whom Hydro Archon Egeria turned into people). He called himself Narzissenkreuz and decided to be the first on the path to this goal and dissolved his body, hoping to be reborn in a new form.
The dissolution of the body did not help Narzissenkreuz to be reborn, so Jakob spent all his efforts to preserve Narzissenkreuz. For many months, Jakob experimented to revive Rene. He extracted part of his personality and sealed it under one of the Orthants in the Primordial Sea. He used Lyris's abilities to dissolve and extract people's wills, the records of the Remurians on the creation of golems, knowledge from Khaenri'ah, and the Holy Blade of
which was the key to concentrating the wills of people. (More than 400 years later, the results of Jakob's research were used by the serial killer Vacher, who tried to revive his beloved). He also tried to bring Carter Scherbius back and eventually transferred some of Carter's memories and consciousness into a new Hilichurl body, creating Caterpillar. After many failures, Jakob finally created a new body for Narzissenkreuz, using Carter's remains and a pocket watch given to Jakob by Alain many years ago representing the time when Rene was around.
Narzissenkreuz didn't remember his failure and thought that the trial was a great success. <color=#ffffffd9>"Everything has become consummately clear. All meaningless obstacles have vanished."</color> He acquired a new body and sent Jakob, Lyris, and Caterpillar to Elynas, and remained in the Primordial Sea to await the fulfillment of the prophecy and the beginning of the apocalypse.

customize.text: Ancient Colors

Many years later, Jakob became interested in the paintings of the Melusine Mamere. He introduced himself to the Melusine as a collector and said that he wanted to get her unique paintings for his collection. He hired the Eremites to buy the paintings, but Mamere did not want to negotiate with them. When the mercenaries were about to steal the painting, the Traveler intervened and drove them away. Later, the Eremites and Jakob went to Mamere's house in Merusea Village to find her special paints, but even after turning the whole house upside down, they found nothing. It turned out that Mamere's paints were the crystallized blood of the creature from the Abyss, Elynas, inside of whom the Melusines lived. Several centuries after Elynas' death, his heart shrank, and Jakob had to use the power of the Abyss to restart it and collect enough blood. He needed this power to perform the ritual and complete the plans of the Narzissenkreuz Ordo, as the Apocalypse calculated by the "world-formula" was near. When Jakob reversed the crystallization process with the magic circle, tremors began throughout Elynas's body and the Rifthounds appeared. Jakob tried to get rid of the Traveler but Elynas saved them with the help of his creations — the Breacher Primuses. Elynas was glad that he did not return to life: if his heart began to beat and blood flowed through his veins, all his Melusine daughters would have died.

Their songs have long faded into the pale moonlight, and now, only cool breezes continue to caress these lonely, mint-studded highlands.

The nature of a Breacher Primus defies known categories: they are not animals, plants, Shroom-Kin, nor Elementals. The reason is that based on the current system of knowledge, this problem is like "the definitions prescribed by language and the true nature of things," and it is impossible to have a meaningful, final answer.

customize.text: In the Wake of Narcissus

As the prophecy began to come true, Jakob Ingold decided to forge the Holy Blade of Narzissenkreuz and reverse the "Seal of Chymical Marriage" to release the Primordial Sea. He hoped that Narzissenkreuz, who had gone under the tower, would break the seal and take possession of the source of life. Only with the help of the Holy Blade would he be able to continue his unfinished work, gathering the wills of everyone in Fontaine, the continent, and even the entire planet unto himself. As the Primordial Sea would return once more, and as the
would darken the sky, only he who had been whole unto himself would survive. The will of all souls, being spared from destruction, would welcome a new dawn in the tranquil sea of innocence he would grant them. The Blade of Will would fall into the waters and be grasped by its legitimate owner to gain the power to combat the apocalypse. To prevent spiritual impurities and contaminants from entering the Narzissenkreuz's space, Jakob even performed the "Dispelling Ritual" in the Tower of Gestalt.

Jakob solved the puzzles at the entrance of the three Orthants, collecting the elements of soul, memories, and wishes. Since he was unable to open the last Orthant of Persona, he set a trap there. Having lured the Traveler into the Tower of Gestalt with the last material for the Holy Blade, Jakob tried to take away the Persona element but was defeated. Realizing that his body had almost no strength left, he died under the hand of the clock that struck the beginning of Doomsday, hoping to one day meet Rene in their new world.
The Traveler, Paimon, and Ann the Oceanid descended into the Primordial Sea under the tower and met Narzissenkreuz, who was awaiting the beginning of the apocalypse. He believed that the Traveler wanted to prevent him from saving the world: <color=#ffffffd9>"Why, why has this happened? Why, why did you do this? The new world cannot be born. All will die in a shell, a husk of a dream!"</color>

Narzissenkreuz realized that changes had occurred in the values originally entered into the world formula, since he did not take into account the appearance of the Traveler, the witness of all, in Teyvat.
Accepting his mistake and defeat, Narzissenkreuz agreed to leave and reseal the Primordial Sea. Together with Ann, they went to Mary-Ann in Annapausis. There, he and Ann for a moment became ordinary children: Rene and Mary-Ann Guillotin, as they were during the orphanage. Since Narzissenkreuz had spent all his strength maintaining his will, he learned from Ann and Caterpillar what they had been doing in recent years, and disappeared, remaining forever in Annapausis.
<color=#ffd780>Related Entries:</color>

Law serves to maintain a stable order, which is in turn the cornerstone that equity and justice are built upon.

customize.name: All-Devouring Narwhal
customize.desc:
A mysterious and gargantuan creature from another world.

Poets often liken the starry sky to the ocean. They've seen or dreamt of countless bioluminescent plankton floating on a moonless sea, resembling a galaxy, or the moonlight ripped apart by waves on the sea's surface, like shimmering stars. In the most fantastical stories or outrageous lies, the stars found in the depths of the cosmos might be teeming with life, much like Teyvat, and the universe itself is akin to an ocean. Realistically speaking, however, if a profound universe full of life exists, why hasn't any of that life made contact with Teyvat?

Maybe the universe has been constantly trying to infiltrate Teyvat, or maybe a higher power created borders to protect this world.

customize.text: Carter Scherbius

Scherbius was born more than 500 years ago in a poor family. When something had happened to his entire family, Carter ended up at the Narzissenkreuz Institute, an orphanage in Fontaine. The kind Oceanid Lyris was the Director of the Institute, and the former Admiral of the White Armada Basil Elton was the Vice Director.
Carter became Alain Guillotin's assistant at the Institute of Natural Philosophy many years later. Alain was a child prodigy, while Carter was considered simple-minded and not very smart, although he was older than Alain. Often, he could not understand Alain's discussions but had always supported the latter's ideas. Although they did not have a particularly warm relationship, since Alain did not like Carter's clumsiness and cared about Khaenri'ahn automatons more than people, Carter still always respected him.
During his work as an assistant, he made some friends. One of them was Rene de Petrichor, another brilliant scientist who became Alain's colleague in some projects, and Jakob Ingold – Rene's younger stepbrother, who was considered a little strange, which brought him closer to Carter. He also met Alain's younger sister, Mary-Ann Guillotin, who Carter admired for her warmth, smile, and kindness. He admired the talents of Alain and Rene and believed that Rene and Jakob, the creators of the Narzissenkreuz Ordo, would become very prominent figures in the history of Fontaine. Carter was delighted to learn that Alain, Mary-Ann, Rene, and Jakob were also graduates of the Narzissenkreuz Institute. They talked about their adventures, about Lyris and Basil, which immersed Carter in his childhood memories. Like many graduates of the Institute, Carter dreamed of rebuilding an orphanage that was disbanded and flooded during the Cataclysm 500 years ago.
Despite not being as talented as Rene and Alain were, Carter proposed creating a clockwork Mek capable of taking pictures. He believed that Alain would regret those moments when he hadn't been with his sister, Mary-Ann, and would want to see how she grew up and changed. Although Alain did not initially approve of the idea, he still saw the benefit of such a development for the Maison Gardiennage for its surveillance purpose. It was Carter's idea that led to the creation of Recon Log Mek – a mechanized dog with a camera on its head. Alain created his first Mek to help Mary-Ann when she began working for the Marechaussee Hunters and named it Seymour. In addition, two automatons were named after Carter, Assault and Suppression Specialist Meks.

<color=#ffffffd9>"A clockwork meka adapted from the Cal. Scherbius type. Unfortunately, aside from its ability to attack, it has no other capabilities..."</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>"Alongside the Recon Log Mek, this was one of the first new-type clockwork meka to be made.</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>It was named to commemorate a friend of its inventor and was initially designed to help people. However, its ability to attack people – thereby avoiding the need to put friendly personnel at risk – subsequently became its real strength."</color>

Carter Scherbius had an unknown disease, which left Carter with numbness in his limbs, causing him to frequently break and drop things. On one such occasion, Carter accidentally activated the ruin guard Alain was studying, and Alain had to deactivate the automaton. Due to his illness, Carter often asked for time off work and sometimes even passed out in the hospital. One day, the Director of the Institute of Natural Philosophy, Dwight Lasker, took samples of Carter's blood to send to Sumeru, a region with advanced medicine. But even there, they could not find a cure.

When Rene learned of Carter's illness, he made it his mission to save his friend. He took blood and tissue samples for research, but all the experiments were inconclusive. Then Jakob, who had been exposed to the Abyss for several years to develop new abilities, suggested trying the same method to treat Carter. After much thought and discussion, Rene proposed this experiment to Carter, to which he agreed. Unfortunately, Elynas's flesh, which had a beneficial effect on Jakob, did not help Carter; it only caused rejection and tissue destruction. Despite his condition, Carter remained alive and could make sounds. Even when Rene removed Carter's vocal cords, they grew back within days.
Unfortunately, Rene and Jakob could not cure Carter, but they used all their knowledge to bring him back in a different form.

Alongside the Recon Log Mek, this was one of the first new-type clockwork meka to be made (though of course, after hundreds of years, no one refers to them as "new-type" anymore – this was simply to differentiate them from traditional clockwork mechanisms that were powered by potential energy.)

customize.name: Suppression Specialist Mek
customize.desc:
A clockwork meka adapted from the Cal. Scherbius type. Unfortunately, aside from its ability to attack, it has no other capabilities.

Clockwork meka based on annihilation energy normally produce their energy by utilizing Repeaters composed of special crystals to refine ousia and pneuma from Fontaine's environment. But outside of Fontaine, they can use pre-prepared Energy Blocks to move over short distances for short periods of time. The difference can be observed from the shape of the crystal components on the meka.

customize.name: Recon Log Mek
customize.desc:
One of the earliest new-type clockwork meka to be made.

It is said that during his time at the Institute of Natural Philosophy, the Lord-Artificer Guillotin created machines that could simulate genuine intelligence.

Though he never openly admitted it, this rumor nonetheless spurred on subsequent generations of ambitious engineers. Decades ago, one of them announced that they had created a machine that not only possessed basic thinking abilities but could also read human emotions, but in the end the results went unacknowledged.

customize.text: Caterpillar
Many years ago, Caterpillar was human, but part of his memories were placed in the body of a Hilichurl with the help of the Holy Blade of Narzissenkreuz and the Oceanid Lyris.

<color=#ffffffd9>"— And who are you then?</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>— ...That is not important. What's important is the masters of this imaginary world.</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>They believed that they could save the world, but they didn't know if this world actually needed to be saved. Maybe the world in their memories was but an afternoon forever bereft of blooming sunflowers.</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>But those are their stories and not mine. I'm just a memory that they have of their friend. They once believed that they could save me, but ultimately...</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>The butterfly became a cocoon, and a larva emerged from the cocoon. Then, the larva returned to the void that was never born.</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>But none of these things matter. I have nothing left. I am just a shadow in their memories, left behind by their obsession to save me.</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>I don't hate them, though. Even if they changed after losing me, my existence in this world of memories and delusions is proof of their persistence."</color>

After his creation by the Narzissenkreuz Ordo,
took the form of a child with white skin, blackened limbs, white hair, and nails similar to a Hilichurl. He attributed his appearance and lack of aging to illness. Caterpillar's true form is an Anemo Hilichurl Rogue.
Because Caterpillar aided the Narzissenkreuz Ordo during the battle in Elynas with the Marechaussee Hunters, he was sent to the Fortress of Meropide for his crimes over 400 years ago. Caterpillar supports this decision since he considers himself a monster who should be locked away for what he did.

Caterpillar has hypnotic abilities; he can convince a person of something or guide them. One day, in prison, he met the colorblind artist Julien, who was engaged in the forgery of paintings since he could accurately draw what he saw. Caterpillar was able to convince Julien of his abilities as an artist. As Julien himself believed, Caterpillar allowed him to paint masterpieces. Caterpillar also used his ability with the guard Noailles, who had questions regarding Caterpillar's documents. He convinced the guard that he was a criminal and where he belonged.
Since Caterpillar is not human, he does not have the same qualities, including empathy. During all the years spent in prison, Caterpillar had tried to learn humanity. And while any human helps others out of empathy, Caterpillar only helps because he knows that's what a human would do.

<color=#ffffffd9>"What else is there to say about myself?</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>I often feel mutually exclusive elements in the nature of my existence. Individually, they are pure, but also alien to each other.</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>Therefore, when they interact, they mix with the other and become impure. Can you understand that?</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>My own identity is not consistent... Sometimes I am a Bloomguard, other times a dragon. My identity is a lie built out of the stories of others...</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>But I believe a definitive answer exists, a singular correct answer. As the hands on the clock move again, I'm ready to take that step."</color>

customize.text: Present Day

Several years ago, Caterpillar met a little girl named Lanoire, who was born in prison. Her mother, Agnes, died in the Fortress of Meropide from illness without having time to complete documents for her daughter. Lanoire could not leave prison and go to her relatives since, according to the papers, she simply did not exist. Having made friends with Lanoire, Caterpillar decided to help the girl escape prison. Their chosen method was the "Game of the Rich" – a game invented by the guard Estienne, in which teams competed to collect credit coupons, the special currency used in the Fortress of Meropide. The winning team would be able to travel with Estienne to the surface for periodic checks. Thus, Lanoire could leave prison, and no one would look for her.
Teaming up with Traveler and Paimon, Caterpillar, and Lanoire were able to defeat the other teams, mainly due to Caterpillar, who had been collecting coupons for years by teaming up with other prisoners. Although the Fortress of Meropide guard, Noailles, tried to interfere with the escape plan, Lanoire, and Caterpillar were still able to escape and go to Lanoire's grandfather, Earnshaw, with the help of Estienne.

After rescuing Lanoire, Caterpillar returned to the Narzissenkreuz Ordo, where he was met with the other "heirs'' of the organization: Ann, the Oceanid, and Seymour, the mechanical dog. Seymour was created by Alain Guillotin to protect his sister, Mary-Ann Guillotin; and Ann was created by another Oceanid, Mary-Ann of Annapausis, when she saw Ann in a dream. Together, they decided to find out the secret of Ann's origin and prevent Narzissenkreuz from carrying out his plan to save humanity from the Apocalypse, dissolving the bodily shell of all people in Fontaine with the help of the Holy Blade of Narzissenkreuz.
Caterpillar, Traveler, Ann, Seymour, and Paimon searched for materials to forge the original Holy Blade, capable of dividing and uniting the will. It turned out that three of the four materials have already been found by Jakob Ingold, who was trying to implement Narzissenkreuz's plan. He met with the Traveler and others at the Tower of Gestalt, the headquarters of the Narzissenkreuz Ordo. This meeting marked the beginning of Doomsday, as all four members were gathered together.

When the clock struck midnight, and the hand broke through the room floor, taking Jakob with it, and Narzissenkreuz accepted his defeat, the Traveler, Paimon, Ann, Seymour, Narzissenkreuz, and Caterpillar returned to Mary-Ann. After saying goodbye to Mary-Ann, Ann, and Seymour, Caterpillar decided to go to the realm inside the Book of Esoteric Revelations created by Rene and Jakob to find "something." Time moves differently in this world, and Caterpillar was there for so long that he forgot what he was looking for and began to lose his mind. Inside the Book, Caterpillar met "Puppy," which was a memory of Carter Scherbius, just like Caterpillar himself. It said that the world inside the Book was collapsing, but as long as "Puppy" appeared in the form of a dog and not a Rifthound, there was still a chance of salvation.
The Traveler rescued Caterpillar from this world, but the time spent in the Book left its scars on him. He could no longer take a human form, and his consciousness began to fade. As a farewell, Caterpillar decided to meet Lanoire on her birthday. He thanked Paimon and the Traveler for rescuing him from the Book of Revelation and disappeared, asking Lanoire to tell him her own story someday.

customize.text: Lyris

Lyris was a gentle Oceanid placed in charge of an orphanage, the Narzissenkreuz Institute, as a sign of gratitude to the Hydro Archon Egeria. Although Lyris loved children, she did not have outstanding intellectual abilities even for an Oceanid and did not have an understanding of cause and effect, so the Institute was run by Vice-Director Basil Elton.
When the Cataclysm came 500 years ago, she could not understand why the orphanage was destroyed, and her only desire was to return to the time when the children from the orphanage played as the Narzissen champions. She was found, consumed by guilt, by the members of the Narzissenkreuz Ordo, Rene, and Jakob. Since Lyris had the ability to dissolve and extract people's wills, she became a valuable member of the order, receiving the name "Red Empress."
When Rene dissolved his physical form with the help of Lyris and the Holy Blade of Narzissenkreuz, the Ordo decided to revive Elynas, the monster of the Abyss, with the help of whose flesh and blood Jakob Ingold fed his powers. Lyris went inside Elynas with Jakob and the Narzissenkreuz's apprentice, Caterpillar. In Elynas, they encountered Marechaussee Hunters, including Mary-Ann Guillotin, who attempted to stop the Narzissenkreuz Ordo. During this battle, Mary-Ann Guillotin was seriously injured, and Lyris hugged her and absorbed her consciousness. A new Oceanid, Mary-Ann, was born from this merge. Mary-Ann was no longer either Lyris or Mary-Ann Guillotin but embodied their shared consciousness and desires and was something beyond human or Oceanid, capable of creating other Oceanids.
